medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe short stature, gonadal failure, and early-onset metabolic syndrome
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Severe postnatal growth failure began in childhood for both siblings. Patient 1 exhibited progressive growth failure and did not enter puberty, while Patient 2 similarly failed to enter puberty, diagnosed at age 16 with severe gonadal failure. Acanthosis nigricans developed over time, with Patient 1 diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes at age 27. Both patients displayed early-onset metabolic issues.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 had bilateral cryptorchidism, hemithyroidectomy for multinodular goiter, and cataract surgery; Patient 2 developed a GIST at age 28. Both siblings had hypergonadotropic hypogonadism.
medical_history.family_history: Two siblings died from respiratory infections in infancy; surviving siblings have normal heights. S1 developed Type 2 diabetes at age 40 without dyslipidemia or malignancies.
